title: AI/ML Engineer Fast Track (2026 Batch)
description: A high-velocity, assignment-driven roadmap to transform a 3rd-year student into an ML Engineer ready for placement season.

phases.title: Foundations & The 'Hello World' of ML
phases.description: Move from syntax to Scikit-Learn. Stop watching tutorials; start building.

tasks.title: Pandas & NumPy Sprint
tasks.deliverable: Submit 5 data manipulation scripts (filtering, merging, aggregations).

tasks.title: EDA on Titanic Dataset
tasks.deliverable: Kaggle Notebook link with >80% accuracy on training set.

tasks.title: Linear Regression from Scratch
tasks.deliverable: Python script implementing Gradient Descent without Scikit-Learn.

tasks.title: First Deployable Model
tasks.deliverable: Streamlit app predicting Housing Prices.

phases.title: Deep Dive & Deployment
phases.description: Build production-grade models. This phase is critical for resume building.

tasks.title: FastAPI & Model Serving
tasks.deliverable: API endpoint that accepts JSON input and returns model prediction.

tasks.title: Computer Vision Basics (CNNs)
tasks.deliverable: Digit Recognizer (MNIST) web app using TensorFlow/PyTorch.

tasks.title: NLP Sentiment Analysis
tasks.deliverable: Twitter/Reddit sentiment analyzer deployed on HuggingFace Spaces.

tasks.title: Resume Polish for Amazon ML
tasks.deliverable: Add 'Deployed ML Models' section to Resume.

phases.title: The Capstone
phases.description: End-to-end MLOps or Novel Architecture. This is your placement winning card.

tasks.title: Problem Statement Selection
tasks.deliverable: 1-page PDF proposing a novel solution to a real-world problem.

tasks.title: MVP Development
tasks.deliverable: Working prototype with basic UI and backend.

tasks.title: Final Presentation & Documentation
tasks.deliverable: GitHub Repo with full Readme, Video Demo, and Live Link.

title: GSoC 2026 Cracker Protocol
description: A rigid, backwards-calculated timeline to crack Google Summer of Code 2026 using the 'Community First' approach.

phases.title: Community Bonding & Environment Setup
phases.description: October 2025. The most ignored phase. Establish presence before coding.

tasks.title: Organization Scouting
tasks.deliverable: List of 3 orgs with active IRC/Discord and interesting tech stacks.

tasks.title: Environment Setup
tasks.deliverable: Local build of the codebase running successfully. Screenshot required.

tasks.title: The 'Lurker' Phase
tasks.deliverable: Read 10 recent PRs to understand code style and contribution guidelines.

tasks.title: First Interaction
tasks.deliverable: Introduce yourself in the channel or ask a sensible question.

phases.title: Contribution Mode (Good First Issues)
phases.description: Nov-Dec 2025. Prove you can code. Fix bugs, don't just add features.

tasks.title: Find a 'Good First Issue'
tasks.deliverable: Identify an unassigned issue tagged 'good-first-issue' or 'beginner'.

tasks.title: First Pull Request
tasks.deliverable: Submit a PR fixing a minor bug or documentation error.

tasks.title: Consistent Contribution
tasks.deliverable: 2 Merged PRs in the target repository.

tasks.title: Mentor Contact
tasks.deliverable: Ask mentor for feedback on your contributions so far.

phases.title: Proposal Drafting
phases.description: Feb 2026. The document that decides your fate.

tasks.title: Draft Initial Proposal
tasks.deliverable: Google Doc sharing your project plan, timeline, and deliverables.

tasks.title: Peer/Mentor Review
tasks.deliverable: Get feedback from at least 1 past GSoC scholar or project mentor.

tasks.title: Final Submission
tasks.deliverable: Submit PDF to the GSoC portal before the deadline.
